intro: Ligusticum boreale, commonly known as northern ligusticum, is a perennial herb native to the northern regions of North America. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that appear in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in open woods or along stream banks. Ligusticum boreale is valued for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
